219824789.description:
If you've ever visited Hacker News, you've almost certainly seen the “Show HN” or “Ask HN” posts. Well, it's time to get off the Internet and tell us about it face to face. We'll provide you with our honest feedback, you provide us with a great hack, or idea. 

We'll give you 10 minutes to show off your tool, hack, library, an art project. Great feedback from highly engaged audience is guaranteed! 

List of speakers: 

1.Nathan Millard, G3 Partners

“Implementing Technology in an Analogue Industry - Public Relations”

Bio: Nathan is a Brit who has spent seven of the last 10 years in Asia. He has worked in both corporate and startup environments and has been working with startups in Korea for the last two years, as a tech / startup writer at beSUCCESS.

January 1st 2015 he founded his own startup, G3 Partners, that will provide much needed Global PR and Communications services to early stage Asian startups. G3 Partners aims to implement technology solutions (media tracking, crowdourced press release writing, big data management, data mining) to improve and streamline the traditional PR process. Nathan believes that by employing technology to this industry he can provide a cost effective option that fits the tight budgets of startups, while providing a high quality service.As a second stage G3 Partners will repackage the data derived from press releases, to connect startups with investors (more on that in the presentation). Again, the use of technology will drive this solution. He has had early interest in in the VC service from the likes of Softbank Ventures, K Cube Ventures and Accel Partners.Nathan currently has four clients for the 'front end' PR service, including Yello Mobile, Cloudike, YBrain and Born2Global.

2. Sunghyun Cho, media artist

“Open source_Sound instrument and body”

Bio: Sunghyun Choʼs performative installations have their origin in the perceptive experience of nature, somewhat resembling the early experiences of an infant exploring his or her surroundings.  The artist has presented installations and performances in Seoul, Amsterdam, and Jerusalem, and has created musical scores for two films presented in the Rotterdam Film Festival and the Vancouver Film Festival. 
 http://sunghyuncho.com 

3. Hyekyung Hwang, HIVE ARENA

“How to open your own co-working place”

Bio: Hyekyung co-founded Hive Arena, which provides training on social innovation programs, strategies and events for entrepreneurs in Seoul. She's also a co-organiser of Social Innovation Camp Seoul, bringing people who understand technology and social problem to build technology-based solutions to social problems which can go on to become sustainable enterprises.

4. Joshua James

"Using OpenPGP to secure your communications”

We will talk about some reasons why signing and encrypting communication is important, and what your options are. Specifically, we will focus on public key encryption, OpenPGP and the concept of the Web of Trust. We will demonstrate some tools that allow you to begin securing your communications immediately.

Bio: Joshua is a digital forensic scientist with the Digital Forensic Investigation Research Laboratory. http://cybercrimetech.com

5. Minsu Kang, CEO/Chief Engineer bbdbu, Inc

“buk.io - Serverless web application architecture”

Using AWS S3, CloudFront, Route53 and Front-end Javascript, web applications can be deployed without any server in between. AWS Route53 mixed with S3 provides decent set of name resolution functionalities out of the box. Minimizing server side programming reduces the risk of service interruption as well as enabling the service loading time enhancement by the CDN infrastructure.

Bio:Minsu founded bbdbu, Inc (http://buk.io) recently to revolutionize how knowledge is created and presented. He started his career at Brocade in embedded software field and worked for Cisco, Samsung before he started his own startup company. His main interests are in HTML5, text parsing, content programming languages and intuitive user interface design.

6. Jun Go

“Keeping track of Pomodoro's using Beeminder and Bash”  

Bio: Jun currently works in the OSS/Infra team at Growin as a Linux System Engineer. He writes Bash shell scripts in his day-to-day work and would like to share info about how simple scripts can make your life better.

7. Steve Chung

“The story of Travel Captions”

Steve Chung is a digital nomad traveling around the world while working from home. As a hobby, he shares his travel experiences and photos on http://www.travelcaptions.com. 

This talk will be about how Travel Captions came to be and the design process.

Everything on the website is custom made and the source code can be found here: https://github.com/s12...­

OUR HOST - HIVE ARENA

Co-working place that makes positive impact

http://hivearena.com/
219824789.title: Seoul Hack'n'Tel­­l night #4

229336120.description:
Are you a fan of physical computing, things that fly, Golang, Ruby, or Javascript? If you are, come hang out with us at Fab Lab Seoul on Wednesday, March 16th, 2016 at 08:30 PM. Bring yourself, your drone if you have one, your computer to share your code (if you don't mind), and some beer if you want (these events are BYOB).

I will share my own project for a few minutes, quickly go through the code, attempt to make it fly, and put out any resulting fires. My goal is to make a prototype quadcopter running on a simple microprocessor and a 3D printed / lasercut frame, and make it fly using Golang, Ruby, and Javascript (not at the same time). Then, we'll open up the floor to just hanging out so that anyone who wants to share their own project or experiences or cool videos on the Youtube can do so. Just to be clear, this is not a workshop, this is your chance to show off your awesome builds, your kickass drones, your badass hacks, or just hangout and drink beer (which you bring yourself). If your attention span is as short as mine, I've summarized below as succinctly as I can. Hope to see you there!

Purpose: hangout / share projects / network

Location: Fab Lab Seoul (서울특별시 종로구 장사동 116-4 세운상가 550호)

Approximate Schedule:  8:30 ~ 8:45 PM (Jo shares is project), 8:45 ~ 9:30 (we hang, checkout each other's projects, network)

Date:  March 16, 2016

218774030.description:
SEOUL TECH VER 2.0 + ART EXHIBITION PARTY

w/media artist Lee Rahm and sound performer Sunghyun Cho.

The worlds of art and technology are once again coming together on December 12 at Platoon Kunsthalle. SeoulTech pre-christmas party featuring an art-exhibition by Lee Rahm and a sound performance by Sunghyun Cho offers a perfect opportunity to connect with others who love tech and art. 


Exhibition: “Rahm”

The word “Rahm” represents deep blue, the color of the ocean as extracted from the indigo plant. The same character in its verb form represents the overflowing of energy. In her first solo exhibition Rahm Lee goes beyond defining her medium. You will experience how her works converge and communicate over each others' realms to morph into different forms.


Rahm Lee


The works of Rahm Lee span a wide spectrum from video installations to experimental films that embody her theological and socio-critical perspective through metaphors and symbolism. Rahm Lee's first feature film "Virgin Forest"(2012) was invited to screen at the Torino Film Festival and the Edinburgh International Film Festival. Her second feature film " Yongmun"(2013), based on the motif of Korean humor, was presented in the competition category of the Jeonju Film Festival. Several of Rahm Lee's video installation pieces including "숨:결" and "Uprising Falls" is currently on exhibit.She is at present a resident artist at Platoon Kunsthalle.

http://www.leerahm.com/

Sunghyun Cho

Sunghyun Choʼs performative installations have their origin in the perceptive experience of nature, somewhat resembling the early experiences of an infant exploring his or her surroundings. The recurring themes of his works examine the notions of communication, forms generated from the dynamics of nature, and the relationship between space and sound.

http://sunghyuncho.com
218774030.title: SEOUL TECH VER 2.0  + ART EXHIBITION PARTY @PLATOON KUNSTHALLE

221763389.description:
What is your interest in innovation?

Join the session and get inspiration, learn about outlooks and exchange ideas with our community interested to develop innovation-driven projects and companies.  

The first of the STREAM mini-conferences will discuss the innovation and the challenges to innovation due to advances in Internet infrastructure.


The Internet provides access to fundamental technology that allows inventors and entrepreneurs to realize their projects and products. 


For the first panel, we will discuss the current state of entrepreneurship and innovation, with a specific focus on company formation and the current trend of accelerators as well as new models and frameworks for technology-based innovation. 

In the second panel, a group of companies that have joined our STREAM program will briefly introduce their companies and will share their progress and lessons that learned so far. Rather than pitching for investors or for customers, the intention is to have them share their experience so far and get feedback from our community.

For the third and final panel, we have invited leaders from industry, academia and startups to discuss their perspective on the innovation landscape, particularly for entrepreneurs in Korea that have a global perspective. The speakers in this panel have particular expertise with issues related to innovation in ICT, and we have asked them to share with us the opportunities and barriers to innovation.

We will finish the session with unstructured discussion where the audience is invited to seek out speakers and organizers to provide feedback to projects, to offer practical suggestions for improvement, and to find ways  which to collaborate in our STREAM activities. We would especially like to hear of practical suggestions and even proposals for new projects, products and services.

Agenda

2:00-2:15, Opening and Welcoming Remarks


2:15 -2:55, Panel 1 – STREAM as an Open Accelerator

Mario Garcia, "Building a Community-driven Accelerator"

Nikolay Akatyev, "Meaningful Innovation"

3:00-3:55, Panel 2 – Outlook from Academia, Industry, Startups

Ben Chung, Manager of an Innovation Center, The “Internet” is the greatest invention but is it the greatest tool for “Innovation”?

Nikolay Akatyev, Challenges and opportunities for Internet security (based on discussions with Dr. Joshua James - professor, Aviram Jenik - Beyond Security, Max Goncharov - TrendMicro, Palantir, BoB and other friends)

Hassan Abid, Full Stack Developer

4:00-5:00, Panel 3 – STREAM Members, The Entrepreneurial Journey, Part I

Hassan Abid, Seoul Mate

Jason Kim, My Memoirs

Damian Park, Krown.io

Charles Yu, All Fan Art

5:00-6:00, Open Discussion
221763389.title: [STREAM] The Internet and Innovation

225066005.description:
Welcome to a gathering of makers, hackers, security professionals and academia considering emerging cyber threats. Join in on discussion with this community and contribute knowledge in the fight for a safer, more prosperous cyberspace.

Seoul Tech Society in cooperation with the 7th International Conference on Digital Forensics and Cyber Crime will host panel discussions and technical talks. The event will start with the announcement of awards for the STS / ICDF2C Safe Cyberspace Essay contest. Awards will be presented by the <a>Korea Internet & Security Agency (KISA)</a>.

After the award ceremony, invited panelists will discuss ideas for improving online security for average citizens. The panel discussion will be moderated by Dr. Joshua I. James, ICDF2C General Chair. After the panel discussion, the audience will have a chance to ask questions of the panelists and join in the discussion.

Keep the discussion going after the event by joining attendees for dinner and drinks.

Agenda

• 5.30pm, Gates Open: meet panelists and conference participants

• 6.00pm, Award ceremony for essay contest

• 6.15pm, Panel discussion and technical talks

discussion topic: improve security for emerging cyber threats - DarkWeb, cryptocurrencies and any other poping up ideas

• 7.00pm, Take off for dinner

venue.name: Convention Center of Police Mutual Aid Association

225066005.title: STS / ICDF2C Safe Cyberspace Panel Discussion - emerging cyber threats

222908075.description:
Our guest this time is Héctor Zárate from Spotify.

Spotify has over 60 millions of users listening to music on their mobile devices, so the quality of their app experience is essential. Hector will share the secrets behind Spotify iOS app with overview of problems that have come with their big scale, their everyday strategies to overcome those as well as the archiver results in some key metrics.


Héctor Zárate is Spotify's own iOS cowboy.

Before that, he was bouncing all across Europe like a pinball ball doing mobile applications for banks and other big companies. He writes on his blog iOSCowboy.com and enjoys submitting pull requests to open source projects on Github. He's been a mobile aficionado since his first Palm IIIe.
222908075.title: iOS at Spotify: From plan to done

227263358.description:
Who are we? / 우리가 누구일까요?

We are Ateam Ventures, a 3D printing startup. We want to spread the word that starting your 3D printing journey is easy, and help you get started with some simple workshops. Thank you to Fab Lab Seoul for supplying us with the resources and space, and Seoul Tech Society for helping us reach you, our wonderful community!

우리는 Ateam Ventures 이라는 3D 프린팅 벤처기업 입니다. 저희 간단한 워크샵을 통해 3D 프린팅이 쉽다는 것을 보여드리고 싶습니다. 교육에 필요한 공간과 시간을 제공해준 팹랩 서울에게 감사드리며, 이러한 교육 의 기회를 연결 해주신 Seoul Tech Society에게 도 감사드립니다!


What is this Meetup about? / 이 교육은 도대체 무엇인가요?

3D design, printing, and post-processing as usual. We will show you how to design your own business card holders. No previous design experience is necessary! Then, we will show you how to prepare your file for 3D printing. Then you will 3D print your model. Finally, you will learn how to polish your model to make it look even better. Easy right?

이 교육을 설명해드리자면 3D디자인, 3D프린팅, 및 후처리를 가르쳐 드립니다. 3D 모델링 경험이 없어도 상관 없습니다! 나만의 명함  거치대를 직접~! 만들기 위한 3D 모델링하는 방법을 가르쳐 드리고, 3D 프린터 작동원리와 사용방법, 슬라이싱 프로그램 모두 배우게 되며, 마지막으로 여러분이 설계한 3D 모델을 출력을 한 뒤 후가공 방법까지 배우게 됩니다. 참 쉽죠? :)

What do you need to bring to the Meetup? / 수업에 뭘 준비해가야 하나요?

• Your laptop / 노트북

• A mouse with a scroll wheel / 스크롤 휠이 있는 마우스

• You need to download Autodesk 123D Design, a free 3D modeling software (http://www.123dapp.com/design) / Autodesk 123D Design이라는 무료 3D 모델링 소프트웨어를 다운로드해야 합니다 (http://www.123dapp.com/design)

• 5,000 KRW (cash please) to cover material costs / 재료 값에 충당되는 오천원의 비용

When is the Meetup happening? / 행사는 언제죠?

• This meetup will take place on Saturday [masked]) from 10:30 AM to 12:00 Noon. / 저희는 이 수업을 12월 19일부터 격주에 한번 씩, 토요일 10시반부터 12시까지 팹랩서울에서 진행합니다.

• Because business card holders take a long time to print, you will have to pick up your business card holder either at the following workshop [masked]) or schedule a time to come visit me at my office to pick it up. / 명함 거치대를 출력하는 시간이 오래 걸릴 수 있기 때문에, 수업시간에 출력하지 못했다면 다음 워크샵이 진행되는 1월 2일에 출력물을 가져가야합니다. 또는 다음 워크샵 시간이 가능하지 않다면  별도의 시간을 예약 할 수 있습니다.

• If you want to stay for the optional and free polishing session after lunch, come back again from 1:00 to 2:30 PM. / 또한 여러분이 후가공을 하려는 경우 자신의 프린팅 물을 가져와서 점심 이후시간 (1시-2시 30분) 사이에 진행됩니다. (후가공은 필수가 아닌 옵션 선택입니다.)

Where is the Meetup happening? / 교육은는 어디서 열리는가?

• The meetup will take place at Fab Lab Seoul. / 교육은 팹랩 서울에서 진행됩니다.

Did I forget anything?

Leave a question in the comments section below and I will get back to you as soon as I can! / 아래의 코멘트 섹션에서 질문을 해주시면 최대한 빠르게 대답해 드리겠습니다.

221361191.description:
Arduino Day is a worldwide celebration of Arduino’s birthday. 

On March 28th 2015 Seoul Tech Society together with awesome Fablab Seoul are celebrating 11th birthday of Arduino in South Korea. 

UPDATE #1:

As it turns out, Fablab Seoul is organizing a Make-a-thon on “Smart Furniture” in Suwon on Saturday and Sunday, and we think that it is a perfect way to celebrate Arduino day!

Agenda: make DIY furniture with Arduino inside!

Saturday 28th

10:00 AM: Introduction

10:30 AM: Ice-breaking

11:00 AM: Forming teams

12:00 PM: Lunch

1:00 PM: Team and idea introduction

the rest of the time is actual making


The address is 경기 수원시 영통구 반달로 87

http://place.map.daum.net/8187460


How to get there:

1. BUS from Gangnam Stn

1550-1 or 5100 from Gangnam Stn exit 6 or exit 3 (bus stop in the middle of the road)

Get off at 경희대학교 정류장 [masked]) and 경희대정문 (5100), in front of the Kyung Hee University gate.

Then walk about 10 minutes.


2. BUS from Euljiro-1ga

M5107 from Euljiro-1ga, exit 6.

Get off at 경희대정문, same as 5100.

Then walk about 10 minutes.


3. Subway

To Yeongtong Station 영통역 on Bundang Line.

Then walk about 10 minutes.


This is sudden and unexpected change, we were surprised as well but this sounds too cool to miss!

We definitely want to talk about alternative hardware platforms and Casa Jasmina project there!

UPDATE #2: one more event in Seoul


In case if visiting Suwon is not your cup of tea you still can enjoy Arduino Day in Seoul!

Just join Kocoafab near the Seoul art center!
221361191.title: Arduino Day 2015

RSVP here: http://www.meetup.com/seoulbitcoin/events/222584299/

Our friends at Seoul Bitcoin Meetup are doing a mini bitcoin conference at Google's Campus Seoul.

Here is what they say about it:

222181776.description:
Did you attend the previous STREAM mini-conference on the Internet and Innovation?

Whether you have just discovered this series or want to continue with us on the journey to innovation, we want to invite you to the second second mini-conference on e-Health and Innovation.

After our experience during the first mini-conference, we continue our mission to:


• encourage tech-enthusiasts to realize their innovative ideas, and 


• investigate the challenges and opportunities for academia, industry and startups to produce meaningful innovation.


Join us to discuss innovation in e-Health and its connections to to other emerging areas of technolgy. 

Participants

Developers, entrepreneurs, scientists, researchers, students and professionals interested in eHealth and Digital Technologies.

About

Ogan Gurl will be discussing the pace of change in digital health that has been dazzlingly rapid with new devices, new gizmos, and new apps — a veritable technology parade that can be better described as a headlong spring. Medicine is undergoing a revolution with several paradigm shifts. Some of these transformations are upending medical traditions dating from the time of Hippocrates, and other changes are catapulting 20th-century healthcare into the next era. How to survive and thrive amid such a revolution represents an opportunity for startups and a critical challenge for physicians, governments, and technology companies — indeed all of us.


Agenda

The presentations by the speakers will be short and open-ended, and the topics are designed to open questions for the community to discuss. 


Interactive element. During the ice breakers and audience survey, we will identify 3-5 people who have the following interesting ideas:

• solutions for problems (startups, research projects)


• opinions in terms of challenges and opportunities for innovation


During the interactive segments, the selected audience members will be asked to provide a short introduction to their ideas and will receive on-the-spot feedback from the speakers, organizers, and audience.


• 1:30, Gates open

• 2:00-3:00, Icebreakers and pre-networking 

• 3:00-4:00, Session 1, Ogan Gurel, MD - Chief Innovation Officer at CampusD

       • 20 min - interactive element

219170649.description:
What is Launch Lab?


As part of the Stream knowledge implementation program, SeoulTech is proud to announce the Launch Lab kick off event. Scientists, engineers, entrepreneurs, designers, and any tech enthusiast interested in innovation can discuss and propose projects, as well as solicit ideas and help from other SeoulTech members.

Projects represent early-stage ideas in order to get feedback from the audience and recruit new members to further develop ideas during the up-coming six month Stream program. There will be six presentations total, but this is not a competition. The goal is to share ideas and to learn from each other.


Why?


This program allows members  to get involved with the creation of new ideas or startups, while forging friendships and business partnerships to last a lifetime. 

We are very excited about technology and its potential in the near future, and we want to focus our energy into developing projects that have real-life impact. We hope to help people start projects that can solve relevant issues in Infrastructure, Security, Energy, the Environment, and other areas that have actual real-world relevance. The projects do not necessarily have to take the form of venture-funded startups. Launch lab is not limited only to entrepreneurs, but also open-source projects, non-profit organizations, and all other forms of group, club or organization with an idea for development. Of course, we will also help teams develop relationships with investors if a project has potential as a high-growth startup.


How? 

Apply via the Meetup RSVP. We will pre-select 6 ideas for presentations (10 to 15 minutes), and if anyone gets inspired during the event, we will also have an 'open mic' session for more ideas from any attendee. If you don’t get selected, don’t worry. There will be plenty of time for you to network with others and get feedback during the session. Remember, this is about creating a community, not about competition.

If you have an idea but don’t want to present, bring it with you anyway. There will be plenty of time for you to discuss and share with others.

If you are curious about joining a team or just want to listen and learn, then please come along. We will do our best to make sure everybody gets a chance to participate

When?


Jan 17th, 2015

4pm-5pm

- intro

- presentations

5pm-6pm

- open mic

- feedback & open discussion

After 6.30pm

- dinner and after-party (unorganized, follow your team)


Speakers

1. Harley Jeremiah Jackson, "SNS and IT for Individual Health Empowerment"


Data- and genetics-driven idea for a startup to connect personal health and biotech research through innovative technologies.


2. Hassan Abid, "Seoul Mate, App for Sharing"

The idea helps to share cultural, educational and social experience among various community.

3. Artem Lenskiy, "An Intelligent Health Monitoring, Mobile App"

The idea provides a mobile healthcare check on the go, powered by analytic and remote connection with doctors.

* we preselected 3 speakers and more people can briefly (2-5mins) share their projects and challenges during the 'open mic' session.

Where?

219824813.description:
Hey game aficionados! This one is for you.

Seoul Tech Society,  Minch&Films and Korean Film Archive are glad to invite you to the screening of “State of play”, a documentary about Korean professional gamers. Director Steven Dhoedt will attend the screening and do a Q&A session afterwards.

e-스포츠와 게임팬 여러분들께 기쁜 소식을 전합니다!

민치앤필름과 서울 테크 소사이어티는 여러분을 장편 다큐멘터리 영화 "스테이트 오브 플레이"의 시사회로 초대합니다. "스테이트 오브 플레이"는 최초 벨기에-한국 공동제작 장편 다큐멘터리 영화로, 한국의 프로게이머들의 삶과 도전을 다루는 작품입니다. 영화 상영후에는 감독 스티븐 두트가 시사회에 함께하여 관객 여러분들과의 질의응답 시간을 가질 예정입니다.

STATE OF PLAY 

"Man only plays when in the full meaning of the word he is a man, and he is only completely a man when he plays."

— Friedrich Schiller

A feature documentary about the world of South-Korean professional gamers.

Every year thousands of South-Koreans flock to the game stadiums in Seoul to watch the Pro League, a live sports event where professional gamers compete to be the best at one single video game: Starcraft.

It’s a title many young South Koreans dream of. The game itself is more than a decade old, almost ancient in the fast developing world of video games, but in South Korea it has become a national past-time. Like most specator sports, this world of eSports rapidly evolved in a multi-million dollar business.

In this story, we follow 3 boys in different stages of their career as a Pro-Gamer in South Korea. For some it will be a struggle to stay on top of their game, for others it might be the turning point of their lives.

http://vimeo.com/64767249

EVENT AGENDA: 

7:00 Doors open

7:30 Intro 

7:40 Screening Starts 

9:10 Film ends - QnA session 

9:45 Officially end of the event

행사 개요:

7:00 입장 시작

7:30 소개말 및 환영인사

7:40 영화 시사

9:10 감독과의 대화(Q&A)

9:45 공식 행사 종료

DIRECTOR - Steven Dhoedt 

Steven Dhoedt (°1980, Gent) studied film at the RITS Film Academy in Brussels and graduated as a Master in Audiovisual Arts.

After his studies he settled in Hong Kong for several years where he gained experience as a freelancer producer and director in the local video- and TV commercial industry.

In 2003 he founded the Belgian based production company VISUALANTICS. At the time a collective of filmmakers and new media artists, it developed over the years to an up and coming production house focusing on creative documentaries, fiction films and new media projects.

He made his documentary debut in 2009 with ‘INSIDE THE METAVERSE’, a journey through online virtual worlds. His most recent film is STATE OF PLAY, a creative documentary where he follows the career of several South-Korean professional gamers.

As a producer for Visualantics, he currently has several feature documentaries and short films in development and production.

Most of the time, Steven lives and works in Brussels, Belgium.

SELECTED FILMOGRAPHY – PRODUCER/DIRECTOR

2013 REACH FOR THE SKY / creative documentary / 85’ & 52’ / in HD Writer/Director (inproduction)

2013 EXPRMNTL / creative documentary / 75’ in HD Producer / Director of Photography

2008 VERBRANDMAN / short fiction /14’/ RED ONE 2K Producer

2004 GROENENDAEL / short fiction /24’ / S16 Writer & Director

2004 MADISON FOX – ART TOI? / Music Video / 3’ / DVCAM Director

2003 THE RETURN OF THE 50FT WOMAN / Short fiction, 5min, Betacam SP Producer & Co-Writer

226339196.description:
Greetings fellow makers, tinkerers, designers, and inventors! We at Ateam Ventures and Fab Lab Seoul are excited to be hosting this event series with Seoul Tech Society. 

안녕하세요 메이커, 디자이너 여러분. 저희 에이팀 벤처스, 팹랩 서울 팀원들은 Seoul Tech Society와  같이 이번 이벤트를 개최하게 되어 매우 흥분됩니다! :)


Why are we doing this? (우리는 왜 이것을 하고 있냐구요?)

We want to provide you with the tools and techniques to pursue the creation of beautiful 3D-printed objects even after they've already been printed.

저희는 여러분이 프린트가 이미 완료된 이후에도 더 아름다운 3D 프린트 제품을 만들 수 있도록 장비들과 기술을 제공하고 싶기 때문입니다.


What do we hope to accomplish? (우리는 무엇을 달성 희망 합니까?)

What we hope to accomplish is that whatever 3D printed object you bring into Fab Lab Seoul comes out looking shinier, feeling smoother, and appears less like just another plastic object, and more like the sculpture, tool, or engineering apparatus you dreamed of.

저희가 바라는 것은 여러분이 어떠한 3D 프린트 제품을 가지고오든지 간에 더 빛나 보이고, 더 부드럽게 느껴지도록 만들어 주고 싶습니다. 그리고 단순한 플라스틱 제품이 아니라 당신이 꿈꾸는 조각품이나 공업용 기구에 더 가까워지도록 도와주고 싶습니다.



What exactly will we be doing this coming meetup (November 7th)? (이번 모임에서 정확히 무엇을 하는건가요?(11/7))

1) We will be experimenting with methods to repair broken 3D objects using friction welding. This involves a handheld rotary tool (e.g. Dremel), some spare PLA filament, and your broken 3D prints! 

마찰용접을 사용하여 망가진 3D 제품을 수리하는 방법을 배울 것입니다. Dremel(회전식 도구), 여분의 PLA 필라멘트, 그리고 여러분의 망가진 3D 제품을 가지고 진행할 예정입니다.

2) We will use a acetone vapor chamber built right in Fab Lab Seoul to polish ABS (Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene) plastic models

팹랩 서울에 있는 아세톤 증기 챔버를 이용하여 ABS 플라스틱 모델을 윤기나게 만들 것입니다.


3) We will have tetrahydrofuran and paper towels to lightly polish PLA (Polylactic Acid) plastic objects

Tetrahydrofuran과 종이 타월을 이용하여 PLA 제품을 가볍게 닦을 예정입니다.


What you need to bring 

1) Yourself and any and all interested friends

2) Your plastic models (PLA and ABS) for polishing

3) Your broken plastic models (PLA and ABS) for repairing

How, where, and when are these events happening? (언제, 어디서, 어떻게 이벤트가 진행되는건가요?)

We plan on holding these free "workshops" every other Saturday from 10:00 AM to 11:30 AM starting this November 7th [masked]) at Fab Lab Seoul. Eduardo Charmorro (Fab Lab Seoul) and Joseph Choi (Ateam Ventures) will be there at the very least to provide guidance as needed. Although these events are free, please consider donating to Fab Lab Seoul so we can keep on upgrading the tools and supplies we can provide both you and all your fellow makers!

저희는 이 무료 이벤트를 11월 7일부터 격주에 한번 씩 토요일 10시부터 11시 30분까지 팹랩서울에서 진행합니다. Eduardo Charmorro(팹랩서울), Joseph Choi(에이팀 벤처스) 두 명이 도움이 필요한 분들에게 도움을 드리기 위해 같이 참석할 예정입니다. 무료 행사이기는 하지만 여러분과 다른 동료 메이커들에게 더 나은 장비와 소모품들을 지속적으로 제공할 수 있도록 팹랩서울에 기부해주시면 감사하겠습니다! :)


Suggest Resources

If you want to print a 3D model before coming but don't have printer, consider using Shapengine (http://www.shapengine.com/) website, they can print it for you before the event

If you are interested in reading about friction welding, here is a great link: 

http://makezine.com/projects/make-34/skill-builder-finishing-and-post-processing-your-3d-printed-objects/

If you are interested in reading about polishing 3D printed objects, here is another great link: 

http://airwolf3d.com/2013/11/26/7-steps-shiny-finish-on-abs-parts-acetone/

Happy making!

Feel free to contact Joseph Choi at [masked] if you have any questions or suggestions. Hope to see you soon!

Location of Fab Lab Seoul

Jangsadong 116-4, Sewoon Sang-ga #550 Jong-Ro_Gu, Seoul, Korea

215070482.description:
Do you want to know what is happening beneath the screen?

Let's discover together with Max Goncharov the deep dungeons of underground online economy. Then, we will have a discussion about specifics of Korea.


Max Goncharov is a senior security virus analyst at Trend Micro based in Germany; he is visiting Korea to present at the POC conference.

Joshua James has a broad background of collaboration with police of different countries (including Korea) and academic research.

Details of their profiles and the event's topics are below.

Topic 1:

40 Min.
“Building the Botnet. How much and how easy…”

Online fraud has long since moved from being a mere hobby to a means for cybercriminals to earn a living. Almost every day we can see reports of new cybercrime activity in social networks, blogs and forums, or the part of the easily 'visible' Internet.
There is another side to the Internet however - its criminal underbelly - and here just like on the blogs and forums, communication is key. In this talk we will cover the principles of underground information exchange, ways to secure money/goods in underground transactions and basic cyber hierarchy.
We will also talk about underground products and services. Crypt services, DDoS attacks, Traffic resale, Bulletproof servers, SMS Fraud, Spam services and Credit card Hijacking - these will be covered with pricing comparisons shown over the last 2-3 years. We will go through the typical pricing steps of a criminals attack - from buying software, all the way to monetize the volumes of infected victims.
This presentation will be based on the Max's research paper: http://gmax.at/101

Topic 2:
40 Min.

“APT Targeted attacks use case and cyber underground”


We will analyse some of the most popular Russian underground forums where we can see footprints of possible APT announcement. We will discuss attacks with interesting use cases, such as the attack on the Ukrainian Voting system, as well as possible leads to Russian attackers. Next we will take a look RAT tools and how they are available and wildly used for account hacking which can lead to APT.

Topic 3:

20 Min.

"Cybercrime in Korea and what to watch out for"

Joshua James and students from KITRI's Best of the Best information security program will give a quick discussion about some common cybercrimes that happen in Korea, and how to protect yourselves.

Profile: Max Goncharov TREND MICRO Inc.


Senior security Virus Analyst responsible for security consulting to business partners (internal, external), creation of security frameworks, designing technical security architecture, overseeing the build out of an enterprise incident response process, and creation of the enterprise risk management program.

Participated as a speaker in various conferences and training seminars on the topic of cybercrime and related issues (e.g.cyberterrorism, cybersecurity, underground economy, etc.), like BlackHat, DeepSec, VB, APWG, POC etc.

Joshua James is a researcher with the Digital Forensics Investigation Laboratory as well as a lecturer and researcher with University College Dublin, Korea University, Korea National Police University and Soon Chun Hyang University. Coming from a background in network security and administration, his focus is now on the formalization and automation of digital forensic investigation methods, and the application of these methods in low cost, open source solutions for digital investigators.


Afterparty at 맥주창고 (beer world)

http://goo.gl/V7dW07 - Google maps
215070482.title: Special guest: cyber underground w/ Max Goncharov

241397415.description:
Blockchains have been catching our attention for several years as the technology for bitcoins and other crypto currencies. Let's take a look at another application of blockchain: Decentralized Search.

Agenda

- 7pm: Gate open.

- 7.15pm: Introduction to blockchain, by Chad.

- 8pm: Application of blockchains for the decentralized search, by Emmanuel (remotely).

- 9pm: Closing.

Emmanuel Owusu, is a PhD researcher at Carnegie Mellon University, Chief Architect and Co-Founder of BitClave.


https://www.bitclave.com/ 


When it comes to online advertising, businesses are forced to pay exorbitant amounts of money to “middlemen” in order to reach a captive audience for their promotions. BitClave proposes a system in which the intermediaries are eliminated. Instead of paying any “middlemen”, companies automatically make personalized offers directly to consumers who have opted in for the service. In this ecosystem, consumers have control over their own data and can opt into advertising and analytics services by retailers through the use of smart contracts.
241397415.title: Decentralized Search, Blockchain, and the Future of Online Retail

229064694.description:
Everyday we hear about cyber incidents. They happen with small and big companies and at national level. Cyber fraud and cyber crime affect private assets. This plague spreads world-wide, remember Stuxnet in Iran with a destroyed nuclear power plant or a recent Sony Pictures scandal. It touches Korea as well as, remember stolen personal data of KT users resulted in spam campaigns.

Lee Sult from Nuix and Paul Hadjy from Palantir are traveling to Korea to give a training for cyber security professionals.

With Seoul Tech they will share their first-hand experience with infamous cyber incidents: learn about response measures, focused forensic and data analysis.

If you are interested in cyber security or just an active citizen of cyber space, this event will provide your an opportunity to get new knowledge and involve in advanced discussion with Lee and Paul.

Lee Sult is a Senior Security Consultant at Nuix where he investigates cyber-crime and manages incidents.


http://www.nuix.com/ 

Nuix is a data-driven company providing solutions for investigation, cybersecurity incident response, insider threats, litigation, regulation, privacy, risk management, and other essential challenges.

Paul Hadjy is a Deployment Strategist Lead at Palantir where he helps the company advance into new business lines managing products including Anti-Money Laundering, Insider Threat, Cyber, and government applications. With a recent focus in commercial banking he has helped grow and integrate Palantir in multiple large organizations.

https://www.palantir.com/ 


Palantir makes products for human-driven analysis of real-world data.

Agenda:

7:45pm, Gates Open


8:00pm, Overview of Cyber Incidents and Focused Forensic by Lee

8:45pm, Data Analysis & Cyber Security: Business Side of Big Data by Paul


9:30pm, Continue discussion - informal

Afterparty at 맥주창고 (beer world)

http://dmaps.kr/mkyv - Daum maps 

http://goo.gl/V7dW07 - Google maps
229064694.title: About Cyber Threats and First-Hand Response Experience

225762533.description:
What does Smart City mean to you? The discussion is inspired by an article (see link below) on how Google is trying their hands on city planning. Will sensors and big data change our city-scape? How should public policy change in order to accommodate these changes? Let's have a discussion on how technology could develop cities in innovative ways.

Chan Park a professional in Smart Grid will be joining us to tell more about this component of Smart City.

Reference


http://www.psmag.com/nature-and-technology/google-city-planning-sidewalk-labs


Collaboration w/ Seoul Architecture and Urban Design Meetup

The meetup was originally proposed by Seoul Architecture and Urban Design Meetup. Seoul Tech Society and Seoul Architecture and Urban Design Meetup will seek together synergy between technologies and civil engineering.

http://www.meetup.com/Seoul-Architecture-and-Urban-Design-Meetup/events/224399334/  

About the venue

It is required to order one drink per person there.


https://www.facebook.com/bookcafejungle
225762533.title: [Collaborative event] SmartCity - discussion

222367187.description:
The Apple Watch is available in the US, and our speaker is bringing one to show and share his experiences. 

In this talk Dave will cover, what hardware is included with the Apple Watch, what users can do with it, and what developers can and can not do with it. He will talk about the components of an Apple Watch application and the process of building them.

Dave Koziol is President of Arbormoon Software, and has been working in the Apple software development field for over 20 year. He has worked on 5 applications which rose to be in the top 5 of their categories in the iTunes store in US, and applications he worked on have been featured by Apple on multiple occasions. He hopes to learn more about the mobile software world in Korea.

Location: 5th floor, D.CAMP building.
222367187.title: Technical introduction to the Apple Watch
